citation.article-title: Assignment of ATCC 27377 to Pirella gen. nov. as Pirella staleyi comb. nov.

p.s: Pirella (Pi.rel'la. L.n.pirum pear; M.L. dim. ending -ella; M.L.fem.n. Pirella small pear, referring to the usually pear-shaped cells)
Cells are motile, budding, and nonstalked and frequently form rossettes by attachment with the pointed cell pole.
We determined that the G+C content of the deoxyribonucleic acid ranges from 56.4±0.4 to 57.4±0.3 mol% (Table 3), as determined by the melting point method.
Starr et al. (16) gave values of 58 to 59 mol% G+C; the values of these authors are derived from buoyant density data.
The type species is Pirella staleyi Schlesner and Hirsch 1984, and the genus is monotypic.
